_comment: Example configuration for autocode.py - Multi-model optimization with audit system
_task_manager_config_comment: Configuration for each task manager adapter
_models_comment: Use different models for initialization, coding, and audit sessions
_audit_comment: Audit system reviews work every 10 features using audit_model
_single_model_comment: Or use a single model for all sessions (uncomment to use)

recommended_with_audit.note: Opus for planning & audits, Sonnet for implementation

sonnet_audit_variant.note: Good if tasks are straightforward and well-defined

maximum_savings.audit_frequency: Every 5 features (more frequent due to Haiku)
maximum_savings.note: Only if tasks are very simple and well-defined

premium_quality.audit_frequency: Still audits every 10 features for systemic issues

how_it_works: 1. Coding agent implements features, marks as 'Done [awaiting-audit]'
2. Every 10 features, audit agent (using audit_model) reviews batch
3. Audit agent approves OR creates [FIX] issues for bugs
4. Coding agent fixes bugs, fixes get re-audited

labels.awaiting-audit: Features completed but not yet reviewed
labels.fix: Bug issues created by audit agent

use_cases: Opus init + Sonnet coding + Opus audit = Best quality
Opus init + Sonnet coding + Sonnet audit = More savings
Opus init + Haiku coding + Sonnet audit = Maximum savings
